meanings.definition: A person who watches or looks at something, especially television or a film.
meanings.sent1: The viewers enjoyed the movie at the cinema.
meanings.sent2: Many viewers tuned in to watch the live broadcast.
meanings.sent3: The viewers chuckled at the funny scene in the sitcom.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like keen viewers, absorbing every detail of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The viewers gasped in awe at the breathtaking sunset in the film.

meanings.definition: The number of people watching a particular television program or film.
meanings.sent1: The high viewership of the show led to its renewal for another season.
meanings.sent2: The viewers for the championship game reached record numbers.
meanings.sent3: The viewership for the cooking competition soared when a famous chef appeared.
meanings.sent4: The viewers at home felt like a silent audience, connected through the screen.
meanings.sent5: The viewership graph spiked during the thrilling climax of the movie.
